I could only get through about 10 minutes. Looking at these evil people 
makes me ill.

What is all this business about "understanding" people like this? They are 
evil. They do evil acts. Period. 

The thing is, we teach kids from the time they enter school that there is 
no God (and therefore no ultimate accountability for our actions), that we 
are nothing but evolved animals, that there's no afterlife (either in 
heaven or hell), that there's no such thing as objective truth, that the 
ultimate end of life is to be happy, therefore you must "follow your heart" 
and that there is no other meaning to life other than what you subjectively 
choose to make of it.

Why, then, are we oh-so-shocked when people choose to live out this 
philosophy to its logical, full conclusion?

The shock is not that a group of punks chose to murder a family for no 
reason. The real shock is that most people choose not to. ﻿
I wish I had not watched it.

+Miss Kathy Yeah, like I said, I only watched a bit. I can't bear to think 
of the suffering that poor family endured. And watching these horrible 
"kids" makes me ill.

The families don't appear to be educated. The one mother knew something was 
wrong in the spiritual realm, that is why she stood on a Bible and told her 
daughter to leave.
Interesting the computers came on supernaturally when the van was trying to 
cross the boarder..
Lesson: warn your children to not practice  occultism/Ouija boards.

Right, they chose to practice things they know nothing about. Ouija boards 
a conduit for  demons, "The Exorcism of Emily" was a true story of this 
type of possession.
They didn't seem insane. In fact, they sounded like Sociopaths. No 
feelings.  It is very evil to be able to talk about the killings without 
emotion. YIKES !

+Miss Kathy I wholeheartedly agree!

At the same time, I don't think we need to come at it from simply that 
angle. Doing so makes it seem as though we are trying to excuse the person 
and absolve them of personal responsibility. (Which is also what happens 
with blaming everything on "mental illness"!)

These people are evil and need to face justice accordingly. I don't want to 
hear about their childhood or their psychiatrists or anything else. They 
knew that murdering a family was wrong. They CHOSE to do this heinous act. 
They need to pay, and with their lives. Period.

The modern world does not look at evil and Satan as the root cause. 
Possession is alive and well in 2013.

I hope life means life. I don't care why they did it. They're where they 
need to be. And the rest of us need to remember its not a nice world. ﻿

objection to any behaviors). It doesn't matter whether you call yourself a

but a rejection of morality, rationality, reason, values, logic, and sanity.

I think the religious emphasis does a huge injustice to the bigger picture 
of this case. Whether they choose to indulge in Satanic or Christian 
ideology to justify such disturbing actions is missing the point entirely. 
These children, and they were only children when they committed this crime 
were seriously unhealthy (even that feels like an understatement). They 
lived in an obviously unhealthy community that is riddled with drug abuse, 
domestic and family violence, mental health issues and serious oppression. 
You can lay blame at religion all you like, but what the focus really needs 
to be on is providing help to this community, the young people and the 
families before crimes like this happen.﻿
